/** Date the deadline is due by*/

* @@param date when the task is due by
* Formats the deadline task before it is saved into hard disk
* @return a string that is formatted to be saved into hard disk
* Converts deadline object into string format to describe the task

* Represents Duke, the task tracking smart bot
* deadline</space></name of task></backslash></Date in yyyy-mm-dd format>
* event</space></name of task></backslash></Date in yyyy-mm-dd format><T></Time in mm:ss-mm:ss format>

* @param filePath where to save and load files when Duke closes
* @throws IOException if buffer reads a NULL input
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
/** On what date the event is held on*/
* @param date What day the event is on
* @param start When time the event starts
* @param end What time the event ends
public Event (String description, LocalDate date, LocalTime start, LocalTime end) {
* Formats the Event object so it can be saved on the hard disk

* Converts Event object into string format to describe the event

* what type of event, and schedule of event
/** A list of Task objects to keep track of task changes*/
* Creates a Parser object that is able to process user input
* @param taskList A list of task objects to keep track of task changes
* Recognises command prompts and does the appropriate task handling

System.out.println ("Please state a proper delete command:(");
System.out.println ("Im sorry, but I do not understand what this means:-(");
* Saves and loads files when Duke starts and closes
* Creates a Storage object that can save and load tasks
* Loads previously saved files into Duke when Duke starts up
* @return An Arraylist of task that contains saved files
* @throws IOException when reader takes in NULL input
Event loadedE = new Event(loadedDescription, loadedEDate, loadedStart, loadedEnd);
* Saves current task in Duke when Duke closes
* @param taskList List of task to be saved
* @throws IOException when reader reads NULL input
public void saveFiles (TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Parent class of Todo, Event and Deadline classes
/** Whether the task is done or not*/
* @param description describes the task being created
* Changes the status of the task as "Done"
* Prints out a message to user that task is done
* Lets user know whether task is done or not
* @return whether the task is "Done" or "Not Done"
* Formats the Task object into a string so it can be saved into hard disk
* @return a formatted string representing the task object
* Converts the task object into a string that describes the task
* @return a string that describes the task and whether is has been done
* Represents a list of Task object
/** An list to store the task*/
/** Number of task in the list*/
* Prints out all task in the list
* Marks the task that has been completed
* @param taskNum The task that has been done
System.out.println ("You have already completed this task!");
System.out.println ("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
System.out.println ("Yay! You have no more task remaining!");
System.out.println ("Sorry, there is no such task!");
System.out.println ("Sorry, I dont understand your request!");
//Pending task count drops only if deleted task not completed
System.out.println ("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + deletedTask
+ "\nNow you have " + Duke.pendingTask + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println ("Sorry, there is no such task!");
System.out.println ("Sorry, there is no such task!");
* Adds a new task into the list
* @param type Whether it is a todo,event of deadline task
* @param input Describes the task to be added to the list
public void addTask (String type, String input) {
System.out.println ("OOOPS!! Cannot have empty todo request!!!");
System.out.println ("Got it. I've added the following task:\n" +
todo + "\nYou now have " + Duke.pendingTask + " task in the list");
System.out.println ("Huh? I do not understand this todo request:/");
Deadline deadline = new Deadline(input.substring(9, taskIndex), date);
System.out.println ("Got it. I've added the following task:\n" +
deadline + "\nYou now have " + Duke.pendingTask + " task in the list");
System.out.println ("Huh? This deadline request does not make sense");
Event event = new Event(input.substring(6, taskIndex), date, start, end);
System.out.println ("Got it. I've added the following task:\n" +
event + "\nYou now have " + Duke.pendingTask + " task in the list");
* Prints out all task that contain a particular keyword
* @param keyWord keyword in task that you are looking for
System.out.println ("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
* Gives the arraylist storing all the task
* @param description Describes the Todo object to be created
* Formats the Todo object into a string that can be saved into hard disk
* @return A string that is formatted to be saved into hard disk
* Converts Todo object into string format to describe the task
* @return A string that describes the task and what type of task it is
* Displays images and text in user interface
* Prints the Duke logo and welcomes user
System.out.println(line + "\nWhat can i do for you?\n" + line);
* Prints a line to separate command prompts
* Prints a closing message to the user
assertEquals ("[Not Done] Practice music", new Task ("Practice music").toString());
assertEquals ("[T][Not Done] Finish Homework",new Todo ("Finish Homework").toString());
